intro: Philibertella hirtella, commonly known as the hairy philibertella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Philibertella hirtella is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
